title: 3 Simple Ways to Transfer WhatsApp Audio Messages

steps.title: Open WhatsApp on your computer.
steps.content: Open WhatsApp on your computer. It's a green app with a white phone icon on it. If you don't have the desktop version of WhatsApp yet, download and install it first.

steps.title: Click a conversation.
steps.content: Click a conversation. Your WhatsApp conversations are on the left side of the window. Since the WhatsApp desktop app synchronizes with your phone's WhatsApp app, all of your conversations will appear here.

steps.title: Hover your mouse over an audio message.
steps.content: Hover your mouse over an audio message. You'll see a downward-facing arrow in the top-right corner of the message.

steps.title: Click the downward-facing arrow.
steps.content: Click the downward-facing arrow. Doing so will prompt a drop-down menu next to the message.

steps.title: Click Download.
steps.content: Click Download . It's in the middle of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select a save location.
steps.content: Select a save location. This will determine where the file goes when you download it. For example, you'd click the "Desktop" tab to save your audio message to your desktop.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . It's in the bottom-right corner of the save location window. Doing so will download the audio message from WhatsApp to your desktop. To play the audio message, you'll need to choose a program such as VLC media player or iTunes.

steps.title: Open WhatsApp.
steps.content: Open WhatsApp. It's a green app with a white phone and speech bubble icon. If this is your first time opening WhatsApp on your phone, you'll need to first set up WhatsApp.

steps.title: Tap the Chats tab.
steps.content: Tap the Chats tab. It's at the bottom of the screen. If WhatsApp opens to a conversation, just tap the back button in the top left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap a conversation.
steps.content: Tap a conversation. Doing so will open the conversation. This should be the conversation with the audio message you wish to download.

steps.title: Tap and hold the audio message.
steps.content: Tap and hold the audio message. A bar of options will appear above the message.

steps.title: Tap Forward.
steps.content: Tap Forward . It's the middle option in the bar above the message.

steps.title: Tap the "Share" button.
steps.content: Tap the "Share" button. It's the upward-facing arrow in the bottom-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Mail.
steps.content: Tap Mail . It's the blue app with a white envelope icon. If you don't have iCloud Mail enabled, this option won't work; you'll have to swipe left on the apps listed here to use a different email provider if you have one.

steps.title: Type your own email address into the "To" field.
steps.content: Type your own email address into the "To" field. The "To" field is near the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Send.
steps.content: Tap Send . It's in the top-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Open your email account on a computer.
steps.content: Open your email account on a computer. You may need to log into the email account with your email address and password before you can open it.

steps.title: Click the email from yourself.
steps.content: Click the email from yourself. Doing so should open the email and load the audio message.

steps.title: Download the audio message.
steps.content: Download the audio message. Depending on which email service you use, this process will vary; however, in most cases, you'll click a downward-facing arrow on or below the audio message's icon. Once it's finished downloading, your WhatsApp audio message will be available for listening on your computer.

steps.content: Tap and hold the audio message. Doing so will select it, prompting several options to appear at the top of the WhatsApp page.

steps.title: Tap the "Share" button.
steps.content: Tap the "Share" button. This is the three dots connected by a line in the top-right side of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Gmail.
steps.content: Tap Gmail . It's the top option in the pop-up menu here. Doing so will open an email in Gmail with your audio message attached.

steps.title: Type your own email address into the "To" field.
steps.content: Type your own email address into the "To" field. The "To" field is near the top of the screen, directly below the "From" field.

steps.title: Tap the "Send" arrow.
steps.content: Tap the "Send" arrow. It's the paper plane icon in the top-right corner of the screen.
